intro: Phytolacca purpurascens, commonly known as purple nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple foliage and showy, lantern-shaped flowers. The plant produces toxic berries that contain compounds such as phytolaccatoxin, which can be harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and toxicity, it is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
